__e: It's valid, and I'm not the only one who thinks so.
Okay, he's wrong, and she's... whatever.
But as it turned out, my son doesn't seem to give a whit.
But to be precise, I was right before I was wrong, so...
Because I have never been so sure... and so wrong.
* I can't be too late to say that I was so wrong *
What if we leave and you're wrong?
Sometimes you gotta let them be right, even though you know they're wrong.
But I'm guessing that you have a different point to the story, like maybe...
Oh? I have never been so glad to be wrong.
Today, we have to live with being wrong.
And I know how you hate being wrong.
Meaning I don't think my mother's completely wrong.
Uh, it doesn't matter if he's wrong, you have to let him think he's right, or he'll just take his business somewhere else.
But if you go out there and try to tell him he's wrong... then want to try to whoop everybody, see?
Listen, I don't know how he wronged you-- Dempsey played us both.
If we have wronged someone and reparation can be made, let us know it and make it. Let me make it. What?
Look mother, whatever is I cannot stand to be aggrieved.
